title: AUTOFILL FOR PASSWORDS DOES NOT WORK
content:
I am using Firefox 87 with windows 10. Autofill passwords has always worked, suddenly it no long fills in the password. I have all the correct checks for autofill logon and autofill password, and for FF to ass for both of them on a new site. the information is properly listed in the program list.

I have tried everything i could think of , went to about;config made sure the settings were correct, asked help support page and forums. tried everything tried tried everything what was suggested to solve issue, BUT autofill password still does not work, i have thought of using another program manager, but not sure if that is a good idea thank you very much I sure could use some help with this............ Only other thing i can think is resetting FF but still not sure that would work either. Allen Millner allen-tina@comcast.net
creator: allen-tina

title: Importar certificados
content: Uso MacOS Catalina version 10.15.7 No localizo la ruta: "Herramientas", "Opciones", "Avanzado" y seleccione la pestaña "Cifrado". He visto en anteriores respuestas la ruta alternativa Opciones->Privacidad y Seguridad->Certificados pero tampoco aparece en mi menu. Las opciones de mi menu son: Firefox, Archivo, Editar, Ver, Historial, Marcadores, Herramientas, Ventana, Ayuda. Las opciones en el menu "Herramientas" son: Descargas, Complementos, Iniciar sesion, desarrollador web, informacion de pagina

content:

Refer screen shot. If I click to open it will again show the same window.

Is there any way to open/view HMT file, if, so then how? As these are older files am I making any mistake? Thank you.
creator: Ari94

title: Sync. Please stop or at least prompt!
content:
I don't want to sync work and home browsing. So I do not log in to Firefox at home. A few days ago, I checked my worke webmail which is a GSuite account. Firefox recognized my login and this morning synced my browsing history.

Normally I have up to 60 tabs open and I leave the browser on all the time. Nice and simple to check in on all the things that interest me or things I want to come back to.

You got it, This morning, all my open tabs are gone. All my local history is gone. I now have a shortcut menu bar full of links to work resources that I can't even access as they are behind the work firewall.

Could there not have been a backup made of what I had open? Does it not make sense that if there are tabs open it is not up to FF to decide to close them? Could there not have been a prompt that asked "Hey we want to sync." "This will close all your open tabs" "Is this OK?" Look, I know you want to make it simple and convenient, but please don't assume you know what that means to everyone. You ruined my day, not made it simple or better. Sincerely, kkrofft
creator: kkrofft

title: Firefox stop straming radio on Raspberry PI - works with Chrome
content:
Hello,

I have a Raspberry PI with 4GB of memory and I listen to my radio station Jazzfm.com all day. The problem with Firefox is that once in a while the stream just stops for 10-30 seconds and resumes. I never encounter this problem with Chrome. I tried disabling Performance acceleration - it doesn't help. Sometimes the stream works for hours and then it stops and resumes a couple of times.

I usually have one tab open with the radio stream, others tabs with news, etc. How can I fix this problem?

As I say, Chrome - never an issue, I can stream all day with any interruptions and it's not my broadband, as I am on a Superfast fibre. Does this have something to do with Firefox prioritizing the other tabs? Can I somehow monitor this by launching Firefox from the console to grab any errors?

Thanks, Richard
creator: richlion2

title: One-click search engines are no more "one-click"
content:
Hi there. As we know, when you start typing anything in the search bar, at the bottom of it Firefox displays icons of different search engines, like Google, Wikipedia or IMDB.

In previous versions of Firefox, after typing a word in the search bar, I only had to click once on the search bar icon (for example Wikipedia), and Firefox was automatically loading the website I clicked at, with search results. However in the past 3-4 weeks (after one of the updates) it has changed. Now, when I type the word in the search bar and then I click at a certain search engine icon, Firefox does not automatically move me to this search engine's website - I have to press Enter to load this website. So actually it is necessary to make to clicks - one on the icon, and second one the "Enter" to start the searching.

I know it is a trivial problem and it takes only one moment to press "Enter", however I got used so much to clicking on icon only to start the searching, that after few weeks it still triggers me that I need to additionally press another button :) Can someone help with that, or is it normal now in Firefox?
creator: p.mateusz1990

title: Bookmark importer from Chrome
content: I have recently migrated back to Firefox from Chrome. I followed the instructions to import my bookmarks and forgot that I was logged into my work chrome account, so those bookmarks were imported. When I followed the same procedure using my personal google account, the procedure did not work. Is there a way to import bookmarks from multiple google accounts into Firefox? Any help here would be greatly appreciated. Thank you!
creator: jake.ap.rogers

title: Previous sessions (and closed Tabs)
content:
It would be nice for Firefox to have more than just the last open session available. I recently had to close my browser a couple times to restart my mac. When I re-opened Firefox, the previous open session was gone. It would be nice if the browser had a way of saving not only the very last previous open session but earlier ones.

Maybe someone knows how to easily access those. It seems as though Chrome has started saving earlier sessions.
creator: john.wroughton

title: Firefox logs me out of everything whenever I close it.
content: Every time I close Firefox windows, I'm logged out of all websites I had been logged in to. This doesn't happen automatically at a certain point in time, it only happens when I close all windows. I already tried the about:config thing that was in the solution for another person who had a similar problem, but it didn't work. This has been going on for about a month or two now.
creator: nik.mwango

title: Firefox Keeps Going Unresponsive After 10 to 30 minutes
content: Firefox keeps going unresponsive after 10 to 30 minutes. I tried creating a new places thing. It didn't work, and oddly still let me restore my old session and kept my bookmarks, which it said I'd have to re-install. I'm only running two extensions, U-block and NoScript. It will go Unresponsive, remain so far minutes at a time, briefly return and then immediately go unresponsive again, just long enough for me to close a tab or shut down. Nothing I have done seems to fix this. I am on the latest Windows 10, Desktop, latest Firefox.
creator: WindthinD
